intro: Karatas denticulata, commonly known as the toothed karatas, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Karatas denticulata is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
